title: Which typeface would match the style of the musical symbol ff (fortissimo)?
content:
Hello all,

have read around various places online and this seemed to be the most informed on all typeface matters.

I'm trying to find a font to write in that will be a match for the ff fortissimo symbol  
 [http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/71/Music-fortissimo.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203612/http:/upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/71/Music-fortissimo.png)

I found this discussion elsewhere in the forum [http://typophile.com/node/58526](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203612/http:/typophile.com/node/58526)  
but those suggestions weren't quite right as a match for the fortissimo lettering

The closest looked to be the Berthold Bodoni Old Style BQ Italic but it's not quite right and i can't afford to buy fonts and not have them be the correct one.

Any help or suggestions would be gratefully received. Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Music-fortissimo.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203612/http:/typophile.com/files/Music-fortissimo.png) | 2.62 KB |
author: albatross

comments.content:
Our new [Consul Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203612/http:/www.terminaldesign.com/Fonts/#/ConsulText/TypeTester) might fit the bill.

Just make sure you turn off the ligatures in the type tester when you take a look.
That does look pretty close to the example, but I'm not sure there really is a "correct" typeface for musical notation.
Have you thought about using one of the numerous musical notation fonts which would contain that symbol?

Oh, we've had a very similar discussion before.  
See this thread: [http://typophile.com/node/58526](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203612/http:/typophile.com/node/58526 "http://typophile.com/node/58526")
Doesn't Adobe have a font called Sonata that has all the musical notation?

\*slaps forehead\* Sorry – posting links that were already listed is way uncool.

Don, I think the quest is on for a complete font in that style.
Doh, I knew I should have read more closely. Thanks Nina.
thanks guys will work on these today
I would definitely say that Bodoni bold italic is closer than Century bold italic; there are several different versions of Bodoni, so one can look for a closer match using sites like myfonts.com .
